conclusion: Analyze the p-V diagram and use properties of an ideal gas.
Segment AB is a horizontal line indicating constant pressure.
Segment BC is a vertical line indicating constant volume.
Segment CA is not explicitly shown but initial and final conditions are known.
At point A: Pressure is 3x10^5 Pa, Volume is 1x10^-3 m³, Temperature is 200 K.
At point C: Pressure is 1x10^5 Pa, Volume is 4x10^-3 m³.
Calculate number of moles at point A: n_R = 0.18 mol.
Calculate temperature at point C using ideal gas law: T_C = 266.67 K.
Internal energy change ΔU = 200 J during process from A to C.
Internal energy change formula: ΔU = n c_V ΔT.
Calculate ΔT using energy change: ΔT = 55.56 K.
Final temperature of gas at state C is approximately 256 K.
